page.title: 09KANGOL
page.content: The firm of Kangol was founded in 1937 by Jaques Spreiregan a frenchman to manufachire berets.The firm moved from this product to the manufacture of other hats then into motor cycle-crash helmets.Today the factory in Norfolk street Carlisle is a wholly owned subsidiainy of the American Saftey Equiptment Corperation and is involved in the manufacture of seat belts and childrens safety equipment for the motor industry.The company today employs 328 women and 145 men.They mainly come from Carlisle but some travel from Silloth, Gretna, Brampton and Longtown.The factory contains very modern machinery which is worked by groups of women.Each group is paid for the number of seat belts it produces in a shift.The men are nearly all in staff positions working as foremen managers,salesmen
